holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year’s Day (Anul Nou) and the following day, on January 1 and 2 respectively, are annual holidays in Romania.

holidays.name: Day after New Year's Day
holidays.description: Both New Year’s Day (Anul Nou) and the following day, on January 1 and 2 respectively, are annual holidays in Romania.

holidays.name: Unification Day
holidays.description: Unification Day celebrates the political union between Wallachia and Moldavia, which is deemed as the foundation of modern Romania.

holidays.name: Constantin Brancusi Day
holidays.description: Constantin Brancusi Day is a observance in Romania

holidays.name: Dragobete
holidays.description: Dragobete is a folk holiday in Romania with ancient origins that centers on love and the return of spring.

holidays.name: Mărțișor
holidays.description: Mărțișor in Romania celebrates the start of spring. The name stems from the word March, which is “martie” in Romanian.

holidays.name: International Women's Day
holidays.description: Many people in Romania celebrate Women’s Day on March 8.

holidays.name: March Equinox
holidays.description: March Equinox in Romania (Bucharest)

holidays.name: Orthodox Good Friday
holidays.description: Millions of Orthodox Christians around the world annually observe Good Friday to commemorate the events leading up to Jesus Christ's crucifixion.

holidays.name: Orthodox Easter Day
holidays.description: Easter (Paștele) is both a religious and a national holiday in Romania. The Easter date is based on the Orthodox Christian Church’s calendar.

holidays.name: Orthodox Easter Monday
holidays.description: The Day after Easter (Paștele) is both a religious and a national holiday in Romania. The Easter date is based on the Orthodox Christian Church’s calendar.

holidays.name: Labor Day / May Day
holidays.description: Labor Day (Ziua muncii) is a national public holiday in Romania on May 1 each year.

holidays.name: Mother's Day
holidays.description: Many Romanians celebrate Mother’s Day (Ziua Mamei) on the first Sunday of May.

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Many Romanians celebrate Father’s Day (Ziua Tatălui) on the second Sunday of May.

holidays.name: Monarchy Day
holidays.description: Monarchy Day is a observance in Romania

holidays.name: National Independence Day
holidays.description: National Independence Day is a observance in Romania

holidays.name: Children's Day
holidays.description: Children’s Day (Ziua Copilului) is annually celebrated on June 1 in Romania.

holidays.name: Orthodox Ascension Day
holidays.description: Ascension Day (Înălțarea) is an annual observance in Romania to commemorate the Christian belief of Jesus Christ’s ascension into heaven.

holidays.name: Orthodox Pentecost
holidays.description: Many Christians in Romania celebrate the Pentecost (Rusalii or Rusaliile) public holiday, also known as Whitsunday or Whit Sunday.

holidays.name: Orthodox Pentecost Monday
holidays.description: Many Christians celebrate the Whit Monday (Rusalii or Rusaliile) public holiday in Romania.

holidays.name: June Solstice
holidays.description: June Solstice in Romania (Bucharest)

holidays.name: Flag Day
holidays.description: Romania’s Flag Day (Ziua Tricolorului) is an annual observance on June 26.

holidays.name: National Anthem Day
holidays.description: Romania’s Anthem Day (Ziua Imnului Național) is an annual observance on July 29.

holidays.name: St Mary's Day
holidays.description: The feast day of the Assumption of Mary is a national holiday in Romania on August 15 every year.

holidays.name: September Equinox
holidays.description: September Equinox in Romania (Bucharest)

holidays.name: Halloween
holidays.description: Some places in Romania, including in parts of Transylvania, have special Halloween events inspired by the Dracula theme on October 31.

holidays.name: St Andrew's Day
holidays.description: St Andrew’s Day (Ziua Sfântului Andrei) is a national holiday in Romania on November 30 every year.

holidays.name: National Day
holidays.description: National Day in Romania, also called Unification Day, is an annual public holiday to remember when the country’s provinces became united on December 1, 1918.

holidays.name: Public Sector Holiday
holidays.description: Public Sector Holiday is a public holiday in Romania

holidays.name: Constitution Day
holidays.description: Romania’s Constitution Day is observed on December 8 every year.

holidays.name: December Solstice
holidays.description: December Solstice in Romania (Bucharest)

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve, or the day before Christmas Day, falls on December 24 every year in Romania.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christmas Day is a Christian holiday to celebrate Jesus Christ’s birth in Romania and falls on December 25 every year.

holidays.name: Second day of Christmas
holidays.description: The second day of Christmas falls on December 26 and is part of a two-day Christian holiday in Romania to celebrate Jesus Christ’s birth.

holidays.name: New Year's Eve
holidays.description: Many Romanians celebrate New Year’s Eve (Revelion) on December 31, the last day of the year in the Gregorian calendar.
